name: Bengal Tiger
description: Fewer than 2,500 remain in the wild, primarily found in India and Southeast Asia. Critically endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.

name: Bornean Orangutan
description: Approximately 104,700 remain, living mostly in Borneo. Critically endangered due to deforestation and illegal hunting.

name: Javan Rhino
description: Only about 76 individuals are left, all in Ujung Kulon National Park in Indonesia. One of the rarest rhino species, critically endangered.

name: Mountain Gorilla
description: About 1,063 remain in the wild, located in the mountainous regions of Rwanda, Uganda, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. Endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.

name: Hawksbill Sea Turtle
description: Population is estimated at fewer than 25,000 nesting females, found in tropical waters worldwide. Critically endangered due to poaching for their shells and loss of nesting habitats.

name: Vaquita
description: Only about 10 individuals are left in the wild, found in the northern part of the Gulf of California, Mexico. Critically endangered due to bycatch in illegal fishing nets.
